content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (x=-20.0, y=-70.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-20.0, y=-70.0) with no ingredients to smelt.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-18.0, y=-70.0) with no ingredients to smelt.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-23.5, y=-69.5) storing iron ore and copper ore.
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-23.0, y=-68.0) out of fuel.
- Transport Belts connecting various entities.

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (x=-19.0, y=-65.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-19.0, y=-65.0) with no ingredients to smelt.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-20.5, y=-66.5) waiting for source items.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-16.5, y=-64.5) storing iron plates.
- Transport Belts connecting various entities.

### Iron Ore Mining and Transport System at Position (x=-14.0, y=-53.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-14.0, y=-53.0) out of fuel.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-12.5, y=-54.5) storing iron ore.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-13.5, y=-54.5) waiting for source items.
- Transport Belts connecting various entities.

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (x=0.0, y=0.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=0.0, y=0.0) with no ingredients to smelt.
- Wooden Chest at position (x=1.5, y=0.5) storing coal, iron ore, and iron plates.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=2.5, y=0.5) waiting for source items.

### Belt Systems
- Multiple Belt Groups connecting various entities, facilitating the movement of resources between mining drills, furnaces, and chests.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities on occupied tiles
- Ensure that the target tile is free of other entities before attempting to place a new entity. Remove any existing entities that obstruct placement.

### Errors due to entities being out of fuel
- Regularly check the fuel status of burner mining drills and inserters to ensure they are operational. Refuel them as necessary to maintain continuous production.

### Errors related to full chests
- Monitor the inventory of chests to prevent them from becoming full, which can halt production. Regularly empty chests or increase storage capacity to avoid bottlenecks.
